definition: to research/to check/to investigate/to examine/to refer to/to look up (e.g. a word in a dictionary)

sentences.english: He has been conducted to police headquarters, where he is being subjected to a thorough examination.
sentences.chinese: 现在他已被移交警察总部接受彻查。

sentences.english: 'The president is outraged and has ordered an impartial investigation, ' Mr. Remonde said.
sentences.chinese: 雷蒙迪说，阿罗约总统痛斥暴行，下令彻查。

sentences.english: To demand thorough investigation by relevant departments to arrest the culprit.
sentences.chinese: 要求政府有关部门彻查此事，并将犯案者绳之以法。

sentences.english: We will work with the Kyrgyz side to discover the truth as soon as possible.
sentences.chinese: 我们将与吉方共同努力，尽快彻查事件真相。

sentences.english: The Obama administration promised a full investigation.
sentences.chinese: 奥巴马政府允诺彻查此事。

definition: to find out/to ascertain/to get to the bottom of/to clarify
to try to find out/to trace/to track down
to investigate thoroughly/to carefully inspect/to verify/to ferret out (undesirable elements)
to investigate again/to reopen a case
to investigate and handle (a criminal case)
as the water recedes, the rocks appear (idiom)/the truth comes to light
to report to one's superiors/to appear in the news/to reply to a letter
to punish (someone)/to take disciplinary action against (someone)
to follow up a study/to investigate
